content.heading: HTML Form Elements
paragraphs: This chapter describes the different HTML form elements.

content.heading: The HTML <form> Element
paragraphs: The HTML <form> element can contain one or more of the following elements:
<input>, <label>, <select>, <textarea>, <button>, <fieldset>, <legend>, <datalist>, <output>, <option>, <optgroup>

content.heading: The <input> Element
paragraphs: The <input> element is one of the most used form elements. It can be displayed in several ways depending on the type attribute.
Different values of the type attribute are covered in the next chapter: HTML Input Types.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
<label for="fname">
First name:
</label>
<input type="text" id="fname" name="fname">

content.heading: The <label> Element
paragraphs: The <label> element defines a label for form elements. It's useful for screen-reader users and improves accessibility.
The for attribute of the <label> tag should match the id of the <input> element.

content.heading: The <select> Element
paragraphs: The <select> element defines a drop-down list.
The <option> element defines an option that can be selected.

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
<label for="cars">
Choose a car:
</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars">
<option value="volvo">
Volvo
</option>
<option value="saab">
Saab
</option>
<option value="fiat">
Fiat
</option>
<option value="audi">
Audi
</option>
</select>

content.heading: Allow Multiple Selections:
paragraphs: Use the multiple attribute to allow the user to select more than one value.

Example:
<label for="cars">
Choose a car:
</label>
<select id="cars" name="cars" size="4" multiple>
<option value="volvo">
Volvo
</option>
<option value="saab">
Saab
</option>
<option value="fiat">
Fiat
</option>
<option value="audi">
Audi
</option>
</select>

content.heading: The <textarea> Element
paragraphs: The <textarea> element defines a multi-line input field (text area).

content.heading: Example
paragraphs:
<textarea name="message" rows="10" cols="30">
The cat was playing in the garden.
</textarea>

content.heading: The <button> Element
paragraphs: The <button> element defines a clickable button.

content.heading: The <fieldset> and <legend> Elements
paragraphs: The <fieldset> element groups related data in a form. The <legend> element defines a caption for the <fieldset>.

content.heading: The <datalist> Element
paragraphs: The <datalist> element specifies a list of pre-defined options for an <input> element.

Example:
<input list="browsers"><datalist id="browsers"><option value="Edge"><option value="Firefox"><option value="Chrome"><option value="Opera"><option value="Safari"></datalist>
